name: Paroxysmal Sympathetic Hyperactivity Syndrome (PSHS)
chief_complaint: Episodes of uncontrollable sweating, high blood pressure, and muscle spasms
prognosis: Variable; some patients experience gradual improvement over months to years, while others have persistent symptoms requiring long-term management
description: PSHS is a rare dysautonomic condition characterized by episodic sympathetic overactivity, often occurring after severe brain injury. The pathophysiology involves disruption of inhibitory pathways between the brainstem and spinal cord, leading to unopposed sympathetic outflow. Episodes can be triggered by noxious stimuli or occur spontaneously.
